New Records: The Blazers set a new season-high margin of victory with a 19-point win over the Pelicans, the largest of their four double-digit wins this season.
Key Match Events: Avdija made 10-of-15 field-goal attempts and 4-of-7 three-pointers, leading the Blazers to a 21-9 lead early in the game.
Pre-Game Insights: The Blazers, with the third-worst record in the Western Conference, won the season series against the conference-worst Pelicans 3-1.
Post-Match Reflections: The Blazers' balanced scoring effort, including contributions from multiple players, was highlighted as a team effort.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Portlandâ€™s biggest lead was 18 before the Pelicans trimmed it to 40-24 at the end of the first quarter.
Others: The game was played without forward Zion Williamson, who returned from a 27-game absence and scored 22 points in a previous loss.
